instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A stuck at 5.09V  0.89W and 0.16 amp
threads.message:
This Macbook Came in  when i connect to USB amp meter , its stuck at 5.09V  0.89W and 0.16 amp , I proceeded to open it to check the CD3215 Chips and found at UB300  CB300 was full shorted to Ground , I managed to remove the CB300 and replaced it ,  I plugged again my USB AMP METER and the Behaviour remains the same ,  I tested  CB300 again and  resistance value to ground was normal .366 OHM  , I Thought it might've been CB300 Was probably defective so i went ahead and changed it to a new one and behaviour still the same , So what i did i changed all the 4 CB3215 Chips to new ones and the behaviour never changed I have  measured R7020  and my 5v is there,  when I checked the LDOS 

U3100
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD = 0.020
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC = 0.448
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO = 3.350
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA = 1.813

U3200
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD = 1.796
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC = 0.023
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO = 3.355
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA = 1.804

UB300
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD = 1.815
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC =0.021
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO = 3.216
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA = 0.23

UB400
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD = 1.815
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC =0.230
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO = 3.216
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA =1.796


I was checking on the forum and seeing that someone else that you are helping is having my same issue , another thing  , since those chips come with strong underfill while removing the CD3215 I lost all the NC's pads and they left no trace at all i am not sure if they are NOT CONNECTED  or please advice 

Thank you

threads.title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A stuck at 5.09V  0.89W and 0.16 amp
threads.message:
NC stands for Not Connected, so no problem if these pads have gone.
Be sure all other pads have good trace.

You've got some low readings on U3100/200 and UB300.
However, recheck all LDOs in correct manner; diode mode with red probe at ground ALWAYS.

threads.title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A stuck at 5.09V  0.89W and 0.16 amp
threads.message: Great, I have another know good board here that i was comparing , diode mode readings seem to be fine but the voltages are not i will double check that .

threads.title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A stuck at 5.09V  0.89W and 0.16 amp
threads.message: I got it fixed, I went back to double check as you said , I found CB404 Was giving me OL , So I reflow the  UB 400 And everything went in  smoothly fine , thank you so much for your support , the other guy should just change the CD3215 And he should be all good to go.
